title: new​
content: </> Stater.new( States: State,-- The Table that will have all the States Tick: number?,-- Optional tick to be set. Instance: Model? -- Optional model to be set. ) → Stater

interface Stater { States: {State}-- The Provided States Table, if theres a "Init" state then that function will execute each time the Stater Starts. Info: {any?}-- A table that you can add anything in, this is more recommended than directly inserting variables inside the object. Tick: number?-- The time it takes for the current state to be called again after a function is done. Default is 0 Instance: Model? -- Optional model for when you don't want to do self.Info.Instance. Default is nil. State: State-- The current state that the Stater is on. StateConfirmation: boolean-- If this is enabled, the state MUST return a boolean indicating if the function ran properly. Changed: Signal | RBXScriptSignal -- A signal that fires whenever the State changes. Returns Current State and Previous State StatusChanged: Signal | RBXScriptSignal -- Fired whenever the Stater starts or closes. Returns the current status as a boolean. }  Returns a new Stater Object.

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"No States"	Happens when no States are provided

title: GetCurrentState​
content: </> Stater:GetCurrentState() → string | nil Returns the current state the Stater is on indicated by a string. If none then nil. This is currently the same as self.State.

title: IsWorking​
content: </> Stater:IsWorking() → boolean Returns a boolean indicating if the State currently is on.

title: SetState​
content: </> Stater:SetState( State: string-- The function name inside States represented by a string ) → () Returns a boolean indicating if the State currently is on.

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"No State"	Happens when no State is provided. "Invalid State"	Happens when the state provided doesn't exist.

title: Start​
content: </> Stater:Start( State: string-- The function name inside States represented by a string, this state will be set at the start. ) → () Begins the Stater

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"No State"	Happens when no State is provided. "Already Started"	Happens when the Stater has already started.

title: Stop​
content: </> Stater:Stop() → () Stops the stater and its state.

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"Already Stopped"	Happens when the Stater has already been stopped.

title: Destroy​
content: </> Stater:Destroy() → () Gets rid of the Stater Object.
